etymology.description: 入 + 玉 (“jade”) — a whole piece of jade; pure jade.
etymology.interpretation: Combining 入 over 玉 evokes an intact, unbroken piece of jade, emphasizing purity and wholeness. By extension, it came to express the ideas of completeness and entirety in general usage.

examples.chinese: 我们需要全力以赴(我們需要全力以赴)。
examples.english: We need to go all out.

examples.chinese: 全部门票已经售完(全部門票已經售完)。
examples.english: All tickets have already been sold out.

examples.chinese: 我们要全面了解情况(我們要全面瞭解情況)。
examples.english: We need to fully understand the situation.
